nodes.label: Homer
nodes.description: The legendary author of the Iliad and the Odyssey, two epic poems that are the central works of ancient Greek literature.

nodes.label: The Iliad
nodes.description: An ancient Greek epic poem in dactylic hexameter, traditionally attributed to Homer. Set during the Trojan War.

nodes.label: The Odyssey
nodes.description: One of two major ancient Greek epic poems attributed to Homer. It is, in part, a sequel to the Iliad.

nodes.label: Achilles
nodes.description: A hero of the Trojan War, the greatest of all the Greek warriors, and is a central character in Homer's Iliad.

nodes.label: Odysseus
nodes.description: A legendary Greek king of Ithaca and the hero of Homer's epic poem the Odyssey.

nodes.label: Greek Mythology
nodes.description: The body of myths originally told by the ancient Greeks and a genre of Ancient Greek folklore.

nodes.label: Trojan War
nodes.description: A legendary conflict between the early Greeks and the people of Troy in western Anatolia, dated by later Greek authors to the 12th or 13th century BC.

nodes.label: Epic Poetry
nodes.description: A lengthy narrative poem, ordinarily concerning a serious subject containing details of heroic deeds and events significant to a culture or nation.

commentary: Journey back to Ancient Greece and explore its foundational myths and epic poems.
